ARABIC: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا تَأْثِيمًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They will hear no prattling in it nor any word of wrong.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will hear no nonsense there or talk of sin,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: There they shall hear no idle talk nor any sinful speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will not hear any unnecessary or sinful talk
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They will not hear any useless speech in it, or any sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: No Laghw (evil vain talk) will they hear therein, nor any sinful speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They shall not hear therein vain or sinful discourse,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Therein they shall hear no idle talk, no cause of sin,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: There hear they no vain speaking nor recrimination
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They will not hear therein any vain or sinful talk,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Therein they hear no vain or sinful discourse.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They will not hear therein any vain talk or sinful speech,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Not frivolity will they hear therein, nor any taint of ill,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: No Laghw (dirty, false, evil vain talk) will they hear therein, nor any sinful speech (like backbiting, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: There they shall hear no idle talk, no cause of sin,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Therein they will hear no nonsense, and no accusations.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:25] They will not hear therein, in Paradise, any vain talk, any lewd words, or any sinful words,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (There) in the Garden (hear they no vain speaking) no falsehood or lying oaths (nor recrimination) nor abuse; it is also said: there is no sin on them for it.
